title: (Heavy Metal) Odin - Discography (8CD) 1983 - 2009, mp3, 128-320
description:
(Heavy Metal) Odin - Discography (8CD) 1983 - 2009, mp3, 128-320 kbps

About ODIN
ODIN formed in early 1980 with brothers Jeff Duncan (GUITAR), Shawn Duncan(DRUMS) and Aaron Samson (BASS) While in Jr. High School in Glendale California. Singer Randy O joined forces in 1981 and the rest is history.
ODIN's first EP "CAUTION" was released in 1982. This was a self produced and manufactured EP which landed them opening slots for Los Angeles Metal giants like W.A.S.P, KEEL, Armored Saint, Ratt, Malice and others.
ODIN Released the infamous EP "Don't Take No For An Answer" In 1985. This Album contained the songs "The Writer" and "Shining Love". Shining love became a highly rotated song on KNAC radio and launched ODIN into the forfront of the Los Angeles Metal scene.
ODIN then released thier only full lenth LP "Fight For Your Life". This CD was only available in Japan and was released on the JVC/Victor label. Perris records Re-released this Album in 2002.
The song "12'Oclock High" is on this CD and was featured in the Movie "The Decline Of Western Civilization, The Metal Years". Which leads us to ODIN'S Appearance in the Movie.
In late 1990 Odin released "The Gods Must Be Crazy"..This self financed EP contained the song "Little Gypsy" which was also in the Movie "The Decline Of Western Civilization, The Metal Years" This was to be ODIN'S last record to date. Members of ODIN have gone on to work in various projects(Armored Saint, MadamX, Orpheus with Lawrence Tollhurst, The Thornbirds, Bird Of Prey, DC4, Lostboys).



1983 - Caution (EP)(128)
1985 - Dont Take No For An Answer (EP)(320)
1987 - The Gods Must be Crazy (192)
1988 - Fight For Your Life (192)
1988 - Fight For Your Life (1st Japan Press)(VDP-1309)(320)
2001 - By The Gods (Compilation)(320)
2008 - Human Animal (EP)(192)
2009 - Best Of (Compilation)(VBR)
